results.title: Careers in building
results.creator_credit: Bruce McNaughton, Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions
results.brief_description: A vocational guidance film on the building industry. Shows the erection of a tall city office block; the men and women of the building industry at work in their diverse activities; the craftsmanship and skill required to erect a typical Australian brick veneer home; the development of a new airline terminal; and the construction work involved in a guided missile rocket pad.

results.title: Bradman (Captioned)
results.brief_description: In this unique documentary, Sir Donald Bradman provides his first ever extensive interview on camera. His fascinating insights are interspersed with archival film of his major innings. Other highlights include: “Off the field” scenes during his four tours of England, interviews with former test players Bert Oldfield, Bill Brown and Neil Harvey, and a series coverage of his amazing test statistics.

results.title: It's an outdoor world
results.creator_credit: Dennis Trewin, Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Way to Tomorrow”.
Made to give a balanced view of typical occupations where the work is largely out of doors, showing the relation of field work to administrative and clerical elements and the kind of opportunities that are open for young people interested in outdoor work. Cast includes Norman Kaye and John Derum.

results.title: World of commerce
results.creator_credit: Bruce McNaughton, Ronald Mason, Academy Film Productions and Golden Fleece
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Way to Tomorrow”.
Illustrates the range of occupations in the busy world of commerce available to both boys and girls. Gives examples of occupations in banking and other financial jobs associated with production, marketing and transport. Considers the need for documents, systems of book keeping and administrative skills required, and gives advice on training opportunities for commercial careers.

results.title: Careers in science and technology
results.creator_credit: Bruce McNaughton, Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Way to Tomorrow”.
Explains the scope of employment in scientific and technical fields in Australia. Shows many examples of work in laboratories and workshops and out of doors, covering research and application in physical and biological sciences, meteorology, geology, engineering, instrumentation and automation, power generation, food industries etc. Gives guidance on the prerequisites necessary to enter the fields.

results.title: Boys will be men
results.creator_credit: Don Rennick, Edward Le Lorrain, Margaret Pettigrew and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film takes a candid, inside look at the world of juvenile delinquency and we are shown the tough existence on the streets of North American cities. In the film, boys, some as young as ten years of age, talk about their lives of crime, the things that are important to them and the hopes they hold for the future.

results.title: Boys will be boys (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Dovey, Roger Selleck, Equal Opportunity Resource Unit and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: Examines the attitudes of teenage boys to teenage girls, their peers and their parents. Three segments are dramatised and then discussed by the participants highlighting the conflicts and dynamics of each situation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Dovey, Roger Selleck, Equal Opportunity Resource Unit and Open Channel Productions

results.title: Boys will be boys
results.creator_credit: John Dovey, Roger Selleck and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: A discussion film about masculinity , communication and feelings, this video uses role plays to explore male sexuality, focussing on “mateship”, relationships, boys in the home environment and their behaviour towards girls. A number of short scenes are dramatised, and these are followed by a short discussion about issues raised by the dramas.
